### Pilot Boat Services for Port Colborne, Ontario
#### Reference: PW-23-01019347

The [Great Lakes Pilotage Authority (GLPA)](https://www.glpa-apgl.com/) invites proposals from interested contractors for pilot boat services at Port Colborne, Ontario. This RFP constitutes a competitive procurement process with an open bidding system.

#### Tender Description
The successful contractor will provide pilot boat services to transport pilots between vessels and the docking area off Port Colborne. The scope of services includes:

* Provision of pilot boats for transportation to and from vessels
* Maintenance and operation of pilot boats
* Reporting and record-keeping for all pilot boating activities

#### Contract Requirements

* The contractor is responsible for ensuring compliance with all relevant safety regulations and procedures
* The contractor must maintain a minimum level of liability insurance coverage
* The contractor is required to submit regular reports to the GLPA on all pilot boating activities

#### Important Dates

* **Tender Closing Date:** January 31st, 2023, 3:00 PM EST
* **Solicitation Number:** GLPA-1000027
* **Publication Date:** January 2nd, 2023

#### Eligibility Criteria
To be considered for this RFP, contractors must:

* Be certified with a valid [Canada Transportation Agency](https://www.cta-otc.gc.ca/) license
* Hold the necessary certifications for safe vessel operation
* Have a valid health and safety management system in place

#### Submission Requirements
Bidders must submit their proposals electronically through [Canada Buys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/). Proposals must include:

* Attachments for all relevant documentation (e.g., proof of certification, insurance certificates)
* A detailed breakdown of the proposed services, including costs and timelines
* A site plan for the proposed pilot boat docking area

#### Contact Information

* **French Contact Name:** St-Germain, Robine
* **Email:** rstgermain@glpa-apgl.com
* **Phone:** 613-933-2991 x 222
* **Fax:** 613-932-3793

The GLPA will not be responsible for typographical errors or omissions in the RFP. The successful contractor will be required to enter into a contract with the GLPA upon the completion of a satisfactory evaluation of their proposal. [Canada Buys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/) has posted the full RFP
